meanings.definition: Add notes or comments to a text for explanation or interpretation.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys annotating her favorite books with colorful sticky notes.
meanings.sent2: Students often find it helpful when annotating their textbooks for better understanding.
meanings.sent3: While annotating her recipe book, she accidentally used a marker instead of a pen.
meanings.sent4: His annotations on the map were like bright stars guiding the way.
meanings.sent5: The artist was annotating her sketches with detailed descriptions to remember her ideas.

meanings.definition: Provide explanatory notes or critical comments on a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to start annotating the poem with their thoughts.
meanings.sent2: Writers often annotate their drafts to improve clarity and coherence.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist annotating the menu with funny doodles while waiting for his food.
meanings.sent4: Her annotations on the manuscript were like a wise friend offering advice.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was annotating her findings with precise details to support her theory.

meanings.definition: Mark or highlight key points in a text for future reference.
meanings.sent1: Please remember to start annotating the important dates in your planner.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to annotate key passages in academic articles for quick review.
meanings.sent3: He was annotating the treasure map with colorful symbols to make it more fun.
meanings.sent4: The notes she left on the document were like beacons annotating the crucial information.
meanings.sent5: The detective was annotating the crime scene with small flags to mark evidence locations.
